text: Does any convex optimization (or only feasibility) julia lib support interval arithmetic?

elements.text: Does any convex optimization (or only feasibility) julia lib support interval arithmetic?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

for unconstraint optimisation there is <https://github.com/juliaintervals/intervaloptimisation.jl> For feasibility, if you mean finding the region that satisfies a set of constraint, there is <https://github.com/JuliaIntervals/IntervalConstraintProgramming.jl>

text: I'm not 100% sure on the terminology, but I have a set of linear inequalities, and I want to either know that they are not feasible, or feasible (I think this is always decidable, say if all coeffs are integers?)

elements.text: I'm not 100% sure on the terminology, but I have a set of linear inequalities, and I want to either know that they are not feasible, or feasible (I think this is always decidable, say if all coeffs are integers?)

text: and the numbers I'd start with are of type `Arb` , as given by Hecke: is that compatible with what you're linking to?
